title: Independent Contractors (Retainer Contract) - Review Payment Requests and Submit Tax Invoices
body: The payment cycle is coming to a close... When it's time for you to submit your invoice, you will receive a notification from Papaya inviting you to login to receive the billing additions that have been approved. You will be able to issue a Payment Request (Pro Forma Invoice), and upload any tax invoices required to complete the billing process.Papaya Personal is mobile friendly, and can be accessed through either your desktop or mobile device!Watch our tutorial, or follow along to the steps below:Step 1 - Log Into Papaya Personal: A few days before your payment is due, you will receive an email notification letting you know that it is time to log in to your Papaya personal portal and upload invoices.  Clicking the button on the email will redirect you to log in to the portal.  Step 2 - Sign a Payment Request (Pro Forma Invoice):From your Upcoming Payment dashboard, you can find a completed template of a Payment Request, which includes the pay period, the approved items that have been reported by your finance team, and the currency that you will receive payment in. In case of items that were reported in a different currency than your payment currency, you will be able to see the relevant exchange rate.Review the amounts, add comments if necessary, and finally - add your digital signature to submit your Payment Request. Step 3 - Submit a Tax InvoiceIf required by your finance team, you may need to upload your local tax invoice at the bottom of the page. In this case, you will not be able to submit your Payment Request unless a tax invoice is uploaded as well. Step 4 - Track Your Payment Request Once you click 'Save and Submit', your payment request will be sent to your finance team for review and approval. You will receive an email confirmation letting you know that your submission has been sent and is awaiting final approval. On your Papaya Personal dashboard, you will be able to see the status of your Payment Request: Pending Approval - awaiting review and approval from the finance teamApproved - approved by the finance team! You will be able to download the approved Payment Request and tax invoice if needed.Rejected - If the Payment Request or tax invoice are not approved, you will receive an email informing you of the rejection reason, and you will be able to resubmit the request with the corrected information by clicking the 'Revise Payment Request' button that will be available to you.Step 5 - PaymentsOnce the finance team have approved your Payment Request, your payment will be processed according to your regular agreed on payment schedule.

title: BI Dashboard Tools
body:
All the Papaya BI Suite dashboards have a number of generic tools & data displays:
ToolDetailsAuxilliary DataAll dashboard have auxiliary data fields, indicating applied filters, table row count, and last data refresh timestamp.Data FiltersAll dashboards have data filtering options commensurate with the displayed data. Currency ToggleDashbaords with financial data have a currency toggle that affects all currency data in dashboard.Download OptionsEvery report can be downloaded as either a PDF or an Excel document. Additionaly, you can download either all report data - or selected report sheets.View ManagementYou can save specific views (i.e. reports with applied filters) for easy access, so that you will not have to apply the same filters every time you open the report.
Auxiliary Data
Applying/Clearing Data Filters
All dashboards have a main filter ribbon with filtering options. Filter parameters vary slightly between dashboards. Some dashboards have a More Filters option:
 
To apply data filters:
In the Filter ribbon, make relevant selection/sIf relevant - click More Filters to open additional optionsSlingle-selection filters apply on selection	Multi-selection filters apply after clicking Apply
 
To clear filter application:
In the top right menu, click Clear FiltersAll filtering operations in effect on the report will be cleared.
 
Currency Toggle
To toggle dashboard currency between Euros & US$, use the currency toggle in the top-right of the dashbaord screen:
 
 
Download Options
To download dashboard data:
In the top right-corner menu, click Download.Select PDF or Excel file formatSelect the data shees you wish to download (you can only select one sheet)Click Download.
 
Report Views Management
To save a report view for easy access, take the following steps:
Apply report filtersIn the top right menu, click Original ViewIn the Change View dialog, click Add ViewEnter view name in the Create New View dialogIf you wish to make this view your default view - switch the Make it my view toggleClick SaveThe view will be added to the View menu
 
To view a saved report view, take the following steps:
In the top right menu, click on the View menu In the Change View dialog, click on the view you wish to select.	Note that the default view is identified by a starThe report will update to display the selected view.
 
To edit/delete a saved report view, take the following steps:
In the top right menu, click on the View menuHover over the report view you wish to edit/deleteClick the edit or delete iconsIf you select delete - the report will be deleted following a confirmation dialogIf you select edit - the Edit View dialog will open, enabling you to change the report name.
The Edit function only allows you to edit the report name . If you wish to change view parameters (filters, columns, etc.), you can modify the report view and save it under a new name.

title: Automatic Contract Management for EOR Requests
body:
Papaya has incorporated a Contract Lifecycle Management module into its EOR worker request/onboarding. This module generates, tracks, and manages the contract signing process following initiation of a new EOR worker request.
 
This article details the CLM process, indicating the actions required from non-Papaya stakeholders throughout the process.
 
Following request submission, customer can manage request via EOR Request Page
Customer initiates new EOR worker request via EOR Wizard :		Papaya approves request.Worker receives email with link to Papaya Onboarding Wizard, follows wizard steps, then submits onboarding package:		Papaya receives onboarding package, prepares contract draft, and sends to Partner for review.Partner receives email with link to contract draft, reviews & comments, then sends to Papaya.	Clicking link to contract draft will initiate a 2-factor authentication process.		Papaya updates contract according to Partner feedback, and sends back to Partner for review.	Steps 5-6 repeat until Partner approves contract with no comments.Partner approves contract.Customer receives email with link to contract draft, reviews & comments, then sends to Papaya..	Clicking link to contract draft will initiate a 2-factor authentication process.Papaya updates contract and sends back to Customer for review.	Steps 8-9 repeat until Partner approves contract with no comments.Customer approves contract.Papaya receives contract and prepares document for digital signing, then sends to worker.Worker receives email with link to contract draft, and:	Signs contract (go to step #13)	OR	Rejects contract and enters rejection reason (go to step #4)	If contract is rejected, Partner and Customer receive email notification.Worker signs contract.Partner signs contract.	Following Partner signature, Customer+ Partner+Worker receive enail notification.

title: EOR Request Management
body:
The EOR  Request Management page allows you to initiate, view, track, and manage new EOR Worker Requests generated via the EOR Request Wizard.Click here to see a video guide of how to request a new EOR worker
Viewing Requests
Users can view requests generated in/for projects to which they have permissions.
Accessing the EOR Monitoring Page
To access the page, open the Papaya Dashboard, then click People>Requests Management:
 
 
Locating a Request
Use the Search dialog to locate specific requests by free text in request fields:
 
 
Filtering Requests
Use filter buttons to filter requests by:
Project - project for which worker was requestedSubmission Date - date on which request was submittedStatus - request status
 
Sorting Requests
Click on any of the headers indicated in the image below to sort by ascending/descending order:
 
 
Request Status & Indicators
Request Status
Request status changes in accordance with triggers generated by actions implemented by system users as well as Papaya admins:
 
StatusDetailsDraftNew EOR request saved as Draft.SentNew EOR request submitted.In ProgressRequest received by Papaya.CompletedWorker entered digital signature on contractAND worker deposit was paid. Cancel PendingCancellation request submitted and awaiting completion.CancelledRequest cancelledNot AvailableHistoric requests
 
Request Indicators
IndicatorDetailsNotesDepositWorker deposit has been paidIf you cannot see this column, you are not required to enter a deposit for new workersContractPapaya has uploaded a signed contract to the system. 
Managing EOR Requests
Supported actions are determined by request status, and can be accessed via table context menu OR Clone button & context menu in the request details page:
 
 
 
StatusSupported ActionsDraftEdit / DeleteSentView / Edit / Clone/ CancelIn Progress
View / Edit / Clone/ Cancel
 
Cancel Request supported only if contract has not been uploaded
CompletedView / CloneCancel PendingViewCancelledView / CloneNot AvailableView 
Deleting a Draft Request
To delete a Draft status request:
Open request context menu and select Delete. In the Delete Draft dialog, click Remove Request.
Deletion is final - deleted data cannot be retrieved
 
Viewing Request Details
To view request details click anywhere on a request row OR open request context menu and select View. Draft status requests do not have a Request Details page: clicking on a Draft request will open the EOR Wizard.
 
 
Editing a Request
To edit a request:
Select Edit from table context menu OR click on rowThe EOR Wizard will open with request details; follow wizard steps and Submit or Save as Draft:
 
Cloning a Request
To clone a request:
Open context menu in table and select Clone OR open request details page and click Clone button. The EOR Wizard will open, with Project details of the cloned request; follow wizard steps and Submit or Save as Draft:
 
Cancelling a Request
To cancel a request:
Open context menu in tableOR open request details page context menu and select Cancel Request.In the Request Cancellation dialog, indicate request source, and click Submit Cancel Request.Request status will be updated to Cancel Pending. Once the cancellation process is completed, request status will change to Cancelled.Cancellation is final - cancelled requests cannot be resubmitted or cloned.

title: EOR Wizard: Initiating Requests for a New EOR Worker
body:
What is an EOR Wizard Request?
Requests to add a new EOR (Employer of Record) worker are initiated via the Papaya Global platform, via user-friendly Wizard.
 
The request process collects basic information and sends it to the Papaya Support team, who’ll contact you to complete the process and upload the worker’s contract details to the platform.
The following users can initiate an EOR request via the wizard: Customer HR Manager, Customer Finance Manager, and Customer Admin.
To create a new Payroll Worker - see Payroll Wizard .
Initiating a New EOR Worker Request
To generate a new EOR Worker request via the EOR Wizard, take the following steps:
Log in to the Papaya PlatformClick People>Add Worker go to the EOR Worker tile, and click Create New Request:The New EOR Worker Request wizard will open:
Working with the Wizard
At any point in the configuration process, you can click the following:
Back - return to previous stepSave as Draft - save all request information in Draft statusNext - proceed to next step; actionable only after current step mandatory fields are populated.
Wizard Steps
Step 1 - Project
Assigning New Worker to an Existing Project
If you want to assign the new worker to an existing project:
 
Select Country in which the new worker's project is located. Click on Project to which the new worker will be assignedClick Next
 
Creating a New Project (Existing Billing Entity)
If you want to assign the new worker to a new project with an existing billing entity:
 
Select the country in which the new project is located.  Click New Project to open new project configuration fields.Only users with permissions to All Projects can create a new project.Select Region/State - region/state in which the project is located.This field is enabled only for the US, Switzerland, Australia, Canada, USA, China.Select project Billing Entity Enter Recepient's Email - for the new project's invoice recepient(s)To create new users for the project - click Company Hub link and generate a request.Click Next
Creating a New Project (New Billing Entity)
If you want to assign the new worker to a new project with a new billing entity:
Select the country in which the new project is located. Click New Project. Only users with permissions to All Projects can create a new project.Select Region/State - region/state in which the project is located. This field is enabled only for the US, Switzerland, Australia, Canada, USA, China. Click New Billing Entity to open new billing entity configuration fields.Enter Recepient's Email - for the new project's invoice recepient(s)To create new users for the project - click Company Hub link and generate a request.Click Next
Steps 2 - Worker Details
Enter worker details (note mandatory fields)For Expat workers:     Worker with work permit- upload document     Worker without work permit - enter nationality to request Papaya support in obtaining permitClick Next
Step 3 - Contract
Enter worker contract information (note madatory fields) Click Next
Step 4 - Compensation
Enter worker compensation information (note madatory fields) .If you want a customized contract (i.e. anything other than the generic template), indicate which document is to be used in the Miscellaneous field of this step.Click Next
Step 5 - Documents
Indicate whether Papaya should send the an Initial Employment Terms Letter prior to contract. Upload any other relevant documents.Click Next
Step 6 - Review & Submit
Review the information for accuracy. Click section edit icon to revise  information.Note mandatory checkboxes:Check the Consent Clause checkbox. Check the Deposit Information checkbox. Worker will be onboarded only after Papaya receives relevant deposit sum.Click Submit
Step 7 - Confirmation Options
The submission confirmation dialog will enable you to: 
Initiate a new request process in the same project as the submitted request Initiate a new request process in a different project Open EOR Request Monitoring page :
FAQs
Who can request a new EOR worker?The following users can initiate an EOR request via the wizard: Customer HR Manager, Customer Finance Manager, and Customer Admin.Can I request an EOR worker for a new location?Yes. You can select a new location (country) and define a billing address + currency, and Papaya will automatically create a new project for your worker. Note that you can create a new project only if you have permissions for all projects.What information should I prepare in advance?- Worker location (and project if you know it).- Worker personal and residency status details.- Contract information with as many details on allowances and compensations.Where can I see the request details following submission?You can view the request information along with all attachments in the Worker profile> Submissions tab.Coming Soon: EOR Request Monitoring Page!What happens after I submit my request?Our support team or your CSM will receive your request and initiate the process to generate the worker’s contract, and contact you within a few days.

title: BambooHR API Integration
body:
Papaya API Integration with BambooHR
 
1. What is the integration? 
Papaya Global’s API integration with BambooHR allows users to sync payroll employee HR and PTO data from BambooHR to Papaya global. 
The integration supports both HR and PTO data; users may choose whether to integrate only HR data or both HR and PTO data.
HR Data SyncPTO Sync
New projects will be added to the daily HR data sync
HR Data from BambooHR to Papaya Global will sync daily
 
The daily data sync only retrieves HR Data for current onboarded projects
PTO data sync will run on the Salary Cutoff dateThe first PTO sync will retrieve data for the preceding 3 monthsData that already exists in the Papaya platform will be skipped in the sync processPTO records with future dates will not be syncedOnly PTO records with an "Approved" status will be synced
 
2. Configuring BambooHR for API Integration
Before configuring a BambooHR API integration in Papaya Global, set up BambooHR:
Choose an Identifier Field for Papaya EmployeesConfigure mandatory employee Location fieldCreate a Custom Access Level in BambooHRAssign the custom level to a dedicated Papaya userPopulate mandatory fields in BambooHR for Papaya Global employees
2.1 Choose an Identifier Field for Papaya Employees
The data synchronization process requires that the Papaya platform identify which BabmooHR employees are Papaya Payroll employees. Use one of the following fields to identify Papaya Employees in the system:
 
LocationDivisionDepartmentEmployment StatusJob Title
 
Following configuration, populate this field for all current and new employees using parameters that will enable you to identify Papaya emolyees. The field must be mandatory for new Papaya employees.
2.2 Create a Custom Field to Map to Papaya Global's projects
A custom field is required for Papaya to associate employees with their projects.A project in Papaya consists of 4 attributes:
Site Location – CountryEmployee Service Type – Payroll, Contractor or EORPay Cycle – Monthly, Weekly, Semi-Monthly, Bi-WeeklyCurrency – USD/EUR/GBP…
e.g., Pragma Project 1 – Italy, Payroll, Monthly, EURPragma Project 2 – UK, Payroll, Monthly, GBPThe custom field can be a pay group id, pay group name, legal entity ID or name, but it must reflect a 1:1 association to a project in Papaya.In the initial setup of the integration, we will map your employees to the associated projects.
2.3 Create a Custom Access Level in BambooHR
To support the Papaya Global integration, you need to create a custom Access Level for your BambooHR user, by taking the following steps:
 
Log into BambooHR with an Administrator level user. Select Settings> Access Levels, then click on the Customize icon, and choose Custom Access Level.The Custom Level Access dialog will open. In the Basic Info tab, enter the access level name and click Next Step.Skip the What this Access Level Can Do step by clicking Next Step In the What this Access Level Can See tab – click All Employees, and select Only Some Employees from the drop-down menu.The Filter Options dialog will open. User the unique field you selected to choose only Papaya Payroll employees, then click Save.The What This Access Level Can See tab will open once again. Scroll down the page to view the Employee Data Filter viewing options:Click on each of the Employee Data Filter tabs (Personal, Job, Time Off, Documents,  Benefits, Training, Assets, and Emergency), and select View Only access.After configuring View Only permissions in all the data filter tabs, scroll down the page, and click Save & Finish.
2.4 Create a Dedicated Papaya User in BambooHR
After configuring the custom field and access level:
Log into BambooHR as an Administrator.Create a Non-Employee user.Assign the Papaya custom access level to this user.
The dedicated user must have a valid email.
2.5 Populate Mandatory Fields in BambooHR
To enable BambooHR to communicate with Papaya Global and integrate HR and PTO data, some fields in BambooHR must be populated for every Papaya Global employee in BambooHR.
 
The following tables specify which fields are relevant to the Papaya Global integration, and which are mandatory and must be populated.
 
In addition to the following, you must ensure that BambooHR has a field that uniquely identifies Papaya Payroll employees, and a location field that supports the format required by Papaya Global.
 
Employee Basic Information Fields:
 
Employee Contact Details Fields:
 
Employee Employment Status Fields:
 
Employee Job Information Fields:
 
Employee Compensation Fields:
 
Employee PTO Data Fields:
3. Configuring Integration in Papaya Global
After configuring BambooHR for API integration with Papaya Global, you can proceed to configure the integration on the Papaya Global Integration Center. For a detailed explanation on accessing the Papaya Global Integration Center, click here .
Note: Only these users can access, view, and use the Integration Center (IC): Customer Admin, Customer HR Manager, Customer Read Only User, users with Org Level Access.
To configure a BambooHR API  integration take the following steps:
Log out of BambooHRSelect integration & integration typeConnect to BambooHRApply mapping schemaConfigure Auto-sync settingsView integration status
3.1 Log out of BambooHR
To prevent SSO issues, log out of BambooHR prior to logging into Papaya to initiate the integration process.
3.2 Select Integration & Integration Type
To initiate the BambooHR API integration and begin the configuration process, click on BambooHR Application  in the Integration Center home page:
 
 
The Integration Details page will open, prompting you to select an integration type - HR or PTO. Click the Connect to BambooHR button next to the integration you wish to implement: HR or PTO
 
Note: Click on the more details links in the integration dialog for information on mandatory fields, required custom field configuration, and more.
3.3 Connect to BambooHR
The Subdomain dialog will open. Enter your BambooHR subdomain, then click Connect & Continue:
 
Note: The subdomain is the first part of your BambooHR domain. If your domain is https://companyname.bamboohr.com your subdomain is companyname.
You will be prompted to login to BambooHR. Click Login with Email and Password, and use the login credentials of the dedicated BambooHR user you created:
 
 
You may be prompted to confirm that your browser is trusted. This is a one-time confirmation request. Click Yes, Trust this Browser:
 
3.4 Apply Field Mapping Schema
The application enables you to map source data from your BambooHr system to target Papaya Global fields. You can create any number of schemas, and apply them to additional connections. 
 
This section explains how to apply an existing schema as-is. For detailed instructions on configuring, editing, and managing mapping schemas, click here.
Following connection to BambooHR, the Field Mapping page will open, displaying the default mapping schema:
 
 
Click the arrow next to the Mapping Names field and select schema from drop-down list:
 
 
Click Change to approve application of selected schema:
 
 
The selected schema will be applied. Click Connect & Continue:
 
3.5 Configure Auto-Sync Settings
Once fields have been mapped and a connection established, configure Auto-Sync settings:
 
Auto SyncHR DataPTO DataEnabled
HR data will be automatically synced every day.
New projects will be automatically added to the auto-sync. 
Auto-sync will attempt to sync all Papaya workers; some updates may fail due to validation/other issues.
Data will be automatically updated on the same date as the Salary Update to ensure it pulls all approved requests for the next payroll cutoff.DisabledYou will be directed to contact your dedicated CSM to implement manual synchronization to update HR data.You will be directed to contact your dedicated CSM to implement manual synchronization to update PTO data.
After setting Auto-Sync, click the Complete Integration button:
 
 
3.6 View Integration Status
Once you have completed configuring a PTO/HR integration, the integration center main page and the BambooHR integration dialog will provide the relvant indication:
 
 
4. Managing Mapping Schemas
4.1 Default Schema
Following connection to BambooHR, the Field Mapping page will open, displaying the default HR or PTO data mapping from the BambooHR source fields to Papaya Global target fields:
 
The default schema cannot be deleted or edited. There is no delete option for the schema, and any edits made to mapping while the default schema is applied can only be saved under a new name.
4.2 General Actions
4.2.1 Enabling Schema Editing
To enable schema editing, select and apply a schema from the schema drop-down, then confirm change. The schema will open in view mode. Click Edit Mapping to enter edit mode:
 
OR open schema drop-down, and click the edit icon next to the schema you want to edit. You will be asked to confirm schema change, then the schema will open in edit mode:
 
 
The default schema does not have an edit icon, as it cannot be changed. 
4.2.2 Deleting Schemas
To delete a schema, open the schema drop-down list, click the Delete icon next to the schema you want to delete, and confirm action:
 
 
The default schema does not have a delete edit icon, as it cannot be deleted.
4.2.3 Creating New Schemas
New schemas are created by applying changes to an existing schema, then saving the changed map under a new name.
 
To create a new schema, enable editing to the schema you want to use as a base, apply changes to mapping fields, then enter a unique name in the Mapping Name field:
 
 
Save the new schema:
If your base schema was the default map, click Save as New
If you selected another base schema, click the Save button arrow, then select Save as New:
 
If any of the mandatory fields are not mapped, the Save action will be disabled, and a tooltip will indicate the issue:
 
4.2.4 Saving Changes to Schema
Changes can be made to all schemas except the default map. If you apply changes to the default map, you can either save it as a new schema or discard the changes.
 
To apply changes to a schema, enable editing to the schema you want to edit, apply changes to mapping fields, then click the Save button:
 
If any of the mandatory fields are not mapped, the Save action will be disabled, and a tooltip will indicate the issue:
 
4.3 Editing Mapping
4.3.1 Editing Source/Target Fields
Enable editing for the schema you want to use as base for the new schema, then click on relevant tab to view current mapping schema:
 
 
Fields can only be mapped once. To change mapping of target fields (e.g map BambooHR Preferred Name field to Papaya First Name field) you must first disconnect existing mapping by selecting Do Not Map this Field - then configure the new connection:
 
 
 
4.3.2 Adding Custom Fields
Custom fields can only be added when configuring HR data integration
Enable editing for the schema where you want to add a custom field, open Custom Fields tab, then click Add Field:
 
 
Map custom field/s to Papaya target fields:
 
4.3.3 Field Transformation - Split
To apply the Split transformation to source data, enable editing to the schema, navigate to the field you wish to configure, then click the transformation icon next to the relevant field:
 
 
In the field transformation dialog, select split transformation type, then choose delimiter:
Click Split Fields, then map source field to target fields. System default is two (2) target fields. use the Add Field button to configure additional target fields for the split data:
Click Apply to save configuration. The main mapping page will show a transformation indicator (green check-mark) next to the relevant field:
To remove the transformation, click on the transformation icon to open the transformation dialog, then click Remove Transformation:
After a transformation is removed, the field will be unmapped:4.3.4 Field Transformation - Lookup
To apply the Lookup transformation to source data, enable editing to the schema, navigate to the field you wish to configure, then click the transformation icon next to the relevant field:
In the field transformation dialog, select Lookup transformation type, then choose lookup table:
In the field transformation dialog, select Lookup, then choose the lookup table. Use the Add New link to configure a new lookup table:
Click Apply to save configuration. The main mapping page will show a transformation indicator (green check-mark) next to the relevant field:
To remove the transformation, click on the transformation icon to open the transformation dialog, then click Remove Transformation:
After a transformation is removed, the field will be unmapped:
5.  Managing BambooHR Integrations
5.1  Active/Draft Integrations
If you exit the integration wizard prior to completing integration by any means - closing the browser window, opening another Papaya page, etc. - your integration will be saved in Draft status, allowing you to complete the configuration process at any time: Draft integrations are indicated in orange, and active integrations in green.
5.2  Editing an Active Integration (Delete/Auto-Sync)
You can only disconnect or change Auto-Sync settings in an active integration.
To edit integrations, access the integration centre as explained above, then set the Integrations toggle to My Integrations to display configured integrations.
My Integrations page displays Active Integrations (i.e. integrations that have been fully configured and are operational) and Draft Integrations (i.e. integrations that have been partially configured and are not yet operational).
Click on an active integration to open the integration dialog for editing:
Click on the context menu to Disconnect the connection, or Disable/Enable Auto-Sync:
5.3  Completing a Draft Integration
To complete a draft integration, access the integration centre , then set the Integrations toggle to My Integrations to display configured integrations.My Integrations page displays Active Integrations (i.e. integrations that have been fully configured and are operational) and Draft Integrations (i.e. integrations that have been partially configured and are not yet operational).Click on a draft integration to complete to open the integration dialog, then click Complete Setup to return to the step in which you closed the integration wizard:
To configure custom fields integration, click Edit Mapping, then click the Custom Fields tab:

title: Expensify Integration
body:
Before continuing, please ensure you have reviewed the Integration Center Support Guide, here.
Expensify Onboarding Process
The following table breaks down the steps required to implement Expensify data integration:
 
Expense Category Note:
Where a breakdown of different types of expenses is required for taxation purposes (mileage, per-diem, phone etc.) the expense policy defined on Expensify must utilize the relevant expense categories.
Currency Note:
Typically, Papaya retrieves expenses in a single currency for each project.The currency will usually be identical to the Papaya project payment currency. A different currency can be configured via Papaya Support.If an employee reports in multiple currencies, conversion must be implemented in Expensify (exchange rate + expense date), so that the reported expense payment retrieved by Papaya will be in the employee’s payment currency.
The following flowchart illustrates the integration process:
 
Ongoing Implementation
The following table breaks down the steps comprising ongoing Expensify data sync with Papaya Global:
 
Note: Manual expense updates in Papaya are blocked for projects that are synced with Expensify to avoid data regression.

title: Dashboard Tab (In-Country Partners)
body: The main dashboard provides a broad overview of every active, closed, and future solution, for each client separately. It shows the number of active people, types of service, and a link to our Countrypedia - Papaya's open-source guide to country's payroll and benchmarks.  You can switch the dashboard display from tiles to list by clicking on the icon in the right corner for a more focused view.  To drill down to any location, simply click on a solution to open the page and see all the information in one easy view.

title: Data Privacy Guidelines (In-Country Partners)
body:
For Papaya, protecting personal data is our number one priority. We treat your data with the same care and diligence as we do our own.  Papaya ensures compliance with GDPR and other privacy regulations through our global workforce management solution, which encrypts documents and secures personal employee information. As a Papaya partner, our tools and standards are available to you, just as we expect your full cooperation to ensure our standards are maintained for all our clients and global workforce personnel. To help, we have defined a few guidelines for the day-to-day communication to make sure sensitive data remains protected at all times: 
Please do not reveal personal information in online communications.  Yes, no info in emails! or Slack, Skype, WhatsApp, etc. This includes names, IDs, bank information and any other private data. 
 
Use work ID numbers to address people in emails without their name (i.e. WID 150781 had a change in tax bracket). To learn more about work ID numbers, see here.
 
Use Papaya's secured platform to share payroll-related documents, as described here . 
 
Documents to share during onboarding or for non-payroll related matters will be shared through dedicated shared drive you will be personally invited to
 
Direct communications with team's personnel should comply with the guidelines above, i.e not sharing personal data in email, even if prompted by person. If there are any questions on how to address specific issues, please don’t hesitate to contact us for solutions. 
By adhering to these guidelines, we can ensure, together, that all data remains protected at all times at the highest level. You can read more in details about our privacy policy and How secure is my data on Papaya?

title: Files Tab (In-Country Partners)
body: The Files tab contains all the documents related to each payment cycle and project, including the supporting documentation for salary updates uploaded by our clients or the Papaya team for easy sharing. These can include time-off reports, commissions reports, team members onboarding packets, and more. Files that you have uploaded through the Payroll tab will also be displayed here. The filters allow you to view any pay cycle, including the current cycle, and to choose the pay step, type, and category you want. You can also use the search bar to look for specific keywords.

title: How secure is my data on Papaya?
body: Protecting your personal data is Papaya's number one priority. We treat all of your data with the same care and diligence as we do our own data. We invest time actively monitoring traffic patterns and interactions for specific security threats. Our robust monitoring system and effective network and data security policies in place allows us to provide end-to-end security and privacy in accordance with most advanced security best practices. You can read more in details in our privacy policy

title: I can't log in to my account, what should I do?
body:
If you are already signed up to the Papaya Platform, you need to use the same email address to log in.
 
Follow these steps to be sure you are using the correct email address and login link:
 
1. Check your email for a message from papayaglobal.com to ensure you are using the correct email address to log in. 
 
If you don't find an email from Papaya, check your other email accounts such as your personal email accounts. 
 
2. To find your company's login link (URL), go to https://papayaglobal.com/find-login/For further instructions review the following article.What is my company's login link to Papaya Platform?
 
If you are still experiencing issues please contact Technical Support
